title: 13 Hidden Gems in Sean Price Williams’ ‘1000 Movies’
excerpt: Josef von Sternberg does love shooting through nets and screens and putting all kinds of things in front of the lens, but you can’t argue with the results! Salvation and damnation in gorgeous black and white. Don’t even need Dietrich for this one.
author: Sarah Shachat
body:
“The Docks of New York” — Josef von Sternberg (1928)

Josef von Sternberg does love shooting through nets and screens and putting all kinds of things in front of the lens, but you can’t argue with the results! Salvation and damnation in gorgeous black and white. Don’t even need Dietrich for this one.

Source: Read the full article
